programme.desc: The yellow taxi cab is the quintessential New York City ride. What started as a small fleet of cars nearly 100 years ago, has turned into a bustling system of thousands of yellow taxi cabs. But now the threat of ride-share apps and city scandal.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: Many things come to mind when thinking about New York City, but how the city deals with its garbage is usually not one of them. New Yorkers produce over 14 million tons of trash each year - and a combination of city agencies and private companies.

programme.title: NYC Revealed
programme.desc: Underneath the ground of New York's fabled streets exists a vast network of pipes that make up the city's sewer system. New Yorkers create, on average, 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day that makes its way through these 7,500 miles of pipes.

programme.title: Nick Taylor Wins the 2025 Sony Open

programme.title: Wyndham Clark Wins 2024 AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am
programme.desc: Wyndham Clark gets his third career win after his victory at a weather-shortened 2024 AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am. Clark broke the course record during the third round after shooting a 60. He finished 17-under par with rounds of 72-67-60.

programme.title: Cam Davis Wins Rocket Mortgage Classic

programme.title: Davis Thompson Wins John Deere Classic

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Princeton, N.J. to get to know the fourth-overall pick in the 2025 PLL Draft: Coulter Mackesy. In this episode of THROUGH X, Mackesy sheds light on his highly touted squash background, explains how he found his one-of-a-kind shooting stroke, and discusses his desire to lead the Princeton Tigers back to an NCAA Championship before turning pro

programme.title: Will Manny Feature
programme.desc: Last year, veteran attackman Will Manny was cast off by the Whipsnakes. TLN followed him to Boston Cannons training camp before the 2025 season to highlight his return to the field 635 days after his last appearance in a PLL game. Watch him prepare for camp at UAlbany, battle with the fourth-overall pick for a spot on the game day roster and, ultimately, help lift the Cannons to victory.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Princeton, N.J. to get to know the fourth-overall pick in the 2025 PLL Draft: Coulter Mackesy. In this episode of THROUGH X, Mackesy sheds light on his highly touted squash background, explains how he found his one-of-a-kind shooting stroke, and discusses his desire to lead the Princeton Tigers back to an NCAA Championship before turning pro

programme.title: Will Manny Feature
programme.desc: Last year, veteran attackman Will Manny was cast off by the Whipsnakes. TLN followed him to Boston Cannons training camp before the 2025 season to highlight his return to the field 635 days after his last appearance in a PLL game. Watch him prepare for camp at UAlbany, battle with the fourth-overall pick for a spot on the game day roster and, ultimately, help lift the Cannons to victory.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the sixth Friday Night Poker cash game! Kelly Minkin, Bryan Piccioli, Marle Cordeiro, Lilou Agostini, Frank Kassela, and Justin Young headline an spooky $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action, with a guest appearance from Daniel Negreanu!"

programme.title: Three
programme.desc: As a birthday gift, a man asks his fiance for a threesome with her friend, which leads to heartbreak and jealousy in their relationship.

programme.title: Cake: A 2nd Slice
programme.desc: Ronnie finds herself in some deep, dark chocolate-like trouble when Heather falls in love with Carmen's unique brownie mix and Rick is in a troubling love triangle.

programme.title: Cake 3: The Last Bite
programme.desc: Ronnie and Carmen's disagreement threatens their friendship; unfinished business dogs Travis and Amanda and Rick are tempted by someone from the past.

programme.title: Chi City Undercover
programme.desc: When newly recruited cop Williamson goes under cover on the West Side streets of Chicago, he has only one goal: take down career criminal and undefeated drug lord Damon Big D Douglass, but Big D has connections and eyes everywhere.

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: When an unemployed actress finds herself broke and sleeping on her best friend's couch, she is forced to get a job as a substitute teacher working with one student. She soon realizes that it takes real super powers to deal with this classroom terror.

programme.title: EscapeCation
programme.desc: Trapped in a smart home, a group of friends faces off against a sinister virtual assistant. They must play its twisted games if they hope to escape.

programme.title: Fist of Vengeance
programme.desc: A woman, struggling with life after the death of her father, discovers a secret operation that is connected to his murder.

programme.title: Flew'd Out
programme.desc: Tiara is a social media influencer who goes viral after posting a video of a fallout between her and a man she was dating. In an attempt to keep up her social media momentum, Tiara accepts an invitation to be flown out to meet a man named Josiah.

programme.title: Intentions
programme.desc: A go-getting marketing director battling sexist colleagues for a coveted VP title gets a new perspective on love when she meets her company mail man.

programme.title: Runway of Shadows
programme.desc: Sisters Ivy and Zara are separated at a very young age due to their father's deceit. When Ivy and Zara unexpectedly cross paths at a prestigious runway show, the stage it set for a series of mysterious and unsettling events.

programme.title: The Devil Came to Duval
programme.desc: After surviving a suicide attempt, comedian Eli Thompson faces his past on his birthday, but a night out at the bar spirals into chaos when the Devil arrives. Eli must confront betrayal, revenge, and supernatural terror to survive.

programme.title: Back Home
programme.desc: A drug kingpin looking to expand his empire finds the venture to be much harder than he anticipated when he lacks support amidst the chaos.

programme.title: Toxic Friendz
programme.desc: Fed up with the status quo, a woman reluctantly attends her coworker's Halloween party, where secrets are revealed and things take a deadly turn.

programme.title: Troublesome
programme.desc: A veteran detective and his rookie partner investigate a homicide case involving a vengeful kingpin who unleashes bloodshed across the city.

programme.title: 3 Way
programme.desc: A Texas couple decides to keep things interesting in their marriage by inviting another woman into their bed, but she has other plans.

programme.title: 3 Way: College Edition
programme.desc: College freshman, Daniella, and her boyfriend, Franklin, set off to separate colleges in Atlanta. When Daniella finds out that her boyfriend is cheating on her, she finds comfort, and connection in her roommate, and her roommate's boyfriend.

programme.title: 3 Way Poly
programme.desc: A young couple's experiment in intimacy spirals into a nightmare when they invite a seductive stranger into their home. Little do they know, she's a killer on the loose, and their lives hang by a thread.

programme.title: Black Girl Magic
programme.desc: Five hilariously talented black women from all walks of life deliver side-splitting comedy: New York's Brooklyn Jones, Los Angeles' Alycia Cooper, Chicago's Just Nesh, Milwaukee's Kelly Kellz and Atlanta's Ashima Franklin.

programme.title: Cuzzo
programme.desc: After a number of failed attempts to pass on his bloodline, a wealthy businessman makes the grave mistake of asking his cousin to impregnate his wife.

programme.title: Dangerous Thirst
programme.desc: In an attempt to spice up their marriage, a young couple steps into the sultry world of swinging, but their journey comes at a price.

programme.title: Deliveries From Eva
programme.desc: Finding he still has a fan, a disgraced music star forms an unlikely friendship with a delivery driver whose fandom grows into a dangerous obsession.

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: A struggling single father attempts a side hustle.

programme.title: Grit
programme.desc: Brought together by their sisters death, three estranged brothers enter into a pact to discover the truth about her murder and bring her justice.

programme.title: Messy
programme.desc: After being sent away to prison for possessing a firearm, Meek Richardson returns home to the DMV to find out his associate Kevin, is killed. Meek seeks to find the truth about his friend's death, and finds that his enemies are closer than it seems.

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals
programme.desc: Tony's ambition ignites a powder keg of betrayal. Driven by Bianca's manipulation, he pushes his pill operation, ignoring Jay's warnings. As DEA Agent Harrison closes in, Jay battles his past to protect Tony. A dangerous deal with Marco, escalates the chaos, leading to overdose and murder plots. Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.desc: The so-called Funniest Serviceman in America draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Steve Brown: Yeah, I Talk Like This
programme.desc: The high-pitched, high-energy voice of comedian Steve Brown is exactly how he talks in his first outrageous comedy set shot live in New York City.

programme.title: Tom Green Live
programme.desc: Following a similar format to a former online show that Tom Green hosted, "Tom Green Live" features the comic interviewing a guest from the entertainment world. Most of the hourlong episodes feature an interview with a single guest who gets grilled by Green and viewers, who are able to ask questions through video chat software. Each episode's initial broadcast airs live, allowing for a deeper look into the guest's life that might not be seen on other talk shows that edit interviews before they air. "Tom Green Live" also features less of a comedic atmosphere than his previous efforts.

programme.title: Joey Coco Diaz: Sociably Unacceptable
programme.desc: It's been 25 years in the making and now Uncle Joey Diaz is at Seeso for his first socially unacceptable special. Prepare yourselves, savages.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: Altamont
programme.desc: Comedian Jay Mohr tackles subjects from unexpected visitors, bringing up children to working with Chris Farley on SNL in his new stand-up special.

programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Time of the Apes" (1987) Science fiction. Two children and a frozen woman wake up 2,000 years later, when apes and a computer rule the world. With Reiko Tokunaga, Hiroko Saito, Masaaki Kaji.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Hillbilllies, holo-clowns and a giant leech named Patches abound when Joel and the Bots take on this bloodsucking tale from acclaimed producer/director Roger Corman.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonder" (1996) Fantasy. A medieval wizard and his wife find trouble when they set up shop in the 20th century. With Ernest Borgnine, George Milan, Bunny Summers.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Parts: The Clonus Horror" (1978) Cult. An escaped clone tries to expose a government plot; Tim Donnelly; Dick Sargent; Peter Graves.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Prisoners of the Lost Universe
programme.desc: The RiffTrax crew teleports into a parallel world of sword and sorcery with a handyman and journalist who try to groin-kick their way back to Earth.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: An Air Force pilot attempts to gain the respect of his father.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Being From Another Planet."

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Zigra" (1971) Science fiction. The big dual-exhaust turtle chucks a boulder onto the razor-sharp back of monster Zigra.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: B movie seems too generous a term for this one is there such a thing as a Z movie? Rondo Hatton plays a disfigured man, a/k/a The Creeper, who hunts down and kills the people responsible for his deformity.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Hercules" (1959) Adventure. Greek muscleman (Steve Reeves) begins 12 labors, saves princess (Silva Koscina).

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Santo invents a time machine that gets him embroiled in the machinations of Dracula.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Magic Sword" (1962) Children. Knight St. George rescues a princess from a sorcerer and his two-headed dragon. With Basil Rathbone, Estelle Winwood, Gary Lockwood.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A secret organization called Mighty Jack (1968) uses a submarine to battle a terrorist organization. Joel and the Bots make a Mighty Jack pet food commercial and sing the song "Slow The Plot Down!".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Star Force: Fugitive Alien II" (1986) Space loner Ken, from Valnastar, guides Earth spaceship Bacchus III on a mission to a far planet.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: When the Dean family patriarch dies, leaving a fortune to his children and servants, they discover they all must spend an entire week at the family estate together, but one by one, they start turning up dead.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Breaker Breaker

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The search for an astronaut on an alien planet.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "War of the Colossal Beast" (1958) Cult. Man-beast escapes in "Amazing Colossal Man" sequel.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Violent Years" (1956) Crime. A newspaperman's daughter runs with a vicious girls' gang; written by Edward D. Wood Jr.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: An experiment on a remote island goes awfully awry when Professor Marlowe Cragis and his research team accidentally create a race of giant, venomous shrews. As the shrews run out of animals to eat, they begin to feast on human flesh!

programme.title: The Film Crew: Killers From Space

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of advice from pruning blackcurrants, taking cuttings and planting bulbs for flowering this Autumn. Carol Klein finds a collection of plants that are at their peak right now and gives her advice on how to grow one of the late summer garden stunners, the monarda while Adam Frost makes the finishing touches to the Leicestershire couple's garden which he helped them start from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team set out on a horticultural adventure to celebrate the south Asian influences on British gardens. Monty Don visits a Hindu temple in Neasden, London, to learn more about the melding of two cultures: the traditional Hindu Mandir and its suburban London location.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.desc: We will take you to some of the wrecks in the Florida Keys that locals love to dive and share their rich history and the stories held deep aboard these sunken ships. We will also take a deep dive and discuss how these wrecks are critical to the environment.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will follow people rethinking how they can make a difference by volunteering to help the environment in the Florida Keys. Whether you are traveling to the Keys on vacation or you live there, people are making a difference by giving back.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We highlight organizations and programs making a difference in the Florida Keys. Learn how they help protect and restore these vital ecosystems.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at the seine net to catch some shrimp. Then meets up with Chef Dave to cook up some amazing Shrimp and Grits. After, Travel to Jekyll Island for the Shrimp and Grits Festival.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we arent talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Josephs Bay on Blacks Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaiis coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: Flavor on the Fly
programme.desc: Welcome to Flavor on the FlyIn the first installment of our newest original series, Chef Ranga Perera trades the towering Rockies for the rolling hills in the Green Mountain State. Out of his element and on a mission to find inspiration for new dishes that embody both the spirit of Vermont and his Sri Lankan roots, Ranga meets with a myriad of enthusiastic characters; each eager to share a small slice of the place they call home. Perch nuggets, sharp teeth, and hot peppers - see what lies in store for our host in the first-ever episode of Flavor on the Fly.

programme.title: Flavor on the Fly
programme.desc: When it comes to the Northeast, Maine stands out as a unparalleled destination. With its rugged coastline, fresh seafood straight from the Atlantic, and charming small towns, there's no place quite like it. In this episode of Flavor on the Fly, Ranga digs deep into his Sri Lankan roots to come up with a seafood curry dish like none other. Inspired by time spent with good friends, fly fishing for both smallmouth and striped bass, and harvesting local shellfish, this tour through the Pine Tree State results in a one-of-a-kind dish that gives cooking with local ingredients a whole new meaning. Follow as we crack open the shell of one of the most intricate and diverse fisheries Ranga has ever explored.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting work on moving a duck blind in September before duck season then hunt it later that season for a two man limit in a flooded rice field. After that hunt Kyle heads to the deer stand where he is able to catch up with a big buck a friend had missed a couple days earlier. On the way to look for the buck he shot he comes across some buzzards that lead him to a different dead buck equal in size. Two Limits of ducks and two Swamp bucks is a hard couple of hunts to top.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally well take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair Wiggins heads out the farthest hes ever been offshore with Capt. Mike Avanon & Capt. Chris Broome in search of a species hes never caught before.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Theres nothing better than seeing millions of migrating fish right near your hometown, so when it happens you can bet Capt. Blair Wiggins will bethere. For this mullet run, he teams up with Capt. Alex Hughey

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at Johns lake house on Tupper Lake, NY. They are checking out some of the damage done to Johns pontoon decking from freezing weather they received. John and the team are upgrading the material, and adding carpeting to the pontoon decking. We also get some information on SPX-Johnson bilge pumps and the ease of access they provide.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway David Reyne is in France, cruising the Seine River, visiting the somber sites of the D-Day Landings plus the spectacular gardens that inspired Monet.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Tony Young for a day of offshore fishing and free diving out of Islamorada.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor chase Tarpon of all sizes around Florida Bay and the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch spotted sea trout and jacks on the grass flats and potholes in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the iconic Seven Mile Bridge targeting big jack crevasses and permit.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: In the 1990s, commercial clamming decimated the Indian River Lagoon clam population. Devoid of clamswhich naturally filter the waterthe lagoons water quality rapidly deteriorated as algae blooms went unchecked and sunlight could no longer reach the seagrass that is so vital to the lagoons ecosystem. 30 years later, a professor at the University of Florida teams up with a well-known deep sea fishing guide to launch the Indian River Clam Restoration Project. After scouring the lagoon and finding ONLY 39 surviving clams, Dr. Todd Osborne and Captain Blair Wigginswith the help of local residents and businessesbegin carefully breeding super clams" to restore the dwindling clam population in the Indian River Lagoon. The Captain & the Super Clams is more than a human intervention success story; its a beautiful buddy film that shows the power of community, science, and technology coming together to find an innovative solution for bio-diversity protection.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team joins the Michigan Department of Natural Resources on the St. Clair River to assist in catching and tagging lake sturgeon as part of an ongoing conservation effort. Aboard the DNRs Channel Cat research vessel, we learn about the sturgeon's ecological role, cultural significance, and the challenges the iconic fish facesfrom invasive species to habitat loss. The project supports sturgeon population recovery through egg collection, hatchery programs, and community events like Port Hurons Sturgeon Fest, organized by the Friends of the St. Clair River. Every year since its inception in 2012, Sturgeon Fest has released young sturgeon back into the wild, contributing to the unique species' resurgence in the Great Lakes region. This year, the Rivers are Life team helped tag two juvenile sturgeons, which made their debut in the popular festival's touch tank before release.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Noah Rucks heads to the rolling hills of Kentucky with hopes high and tags in his pocket. Chasing whitetails through both the early archery season and the later muzzleloader hunt, Noah experiences firsthand how unpredictable and humbling deer hunting can be.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.desc: Mike visits Crystal River and fishes with one of his Citrus County friends, Capt JC Livingston, where they battle the good, the bad and the ugly that comes with Tarpon fishing!

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesnt hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouris gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the Show Me state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, its no different. With Winchesters in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in Americathe wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed Andr 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real Andr announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.desc: Lake Okeechobee comes to mind when you think of Florida bass fishing, and for good reason. Any cast could be a double digit fish of a lifetime. programme.title: Local Knowledge

We also get some information on SPX-Johnson bilge pumps and the ease of access they provide.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: In the 1990s, commercial clamming decimated the Indian River Lagoon clam population. Devoid of clamswhich naturally filter the waterthe lagoons water quality rapidly deteriorated as algae blooms went unchecked and sunlight could no longer reach the seagrass that is so vital to the lagoons ecosystem. 30 years later, a professor at the University of Florida teams up with a well-known deep sea fishing guide to launch the Indian River Clam Restoration Project. After scouring the lagoon and finding ONLY 39 surviving clams, Dr. Todd Osborne and Captain Blair Wigginswith the help of local residents and businessesbegin carefully breeding super clams" to restore the dwindling clam population in the Indian River Lagoon. The Captain & the Super Clams is more than a human intervention success story; its a beautiful buddy film that shows the power of community, science, and technology coming together to find an innovative solution for bio-diversity protection.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team joins the Michigan Department of Natural Resources on the St. Clair River to assist in catching and tagging lake sturgeon as part of an ongoing conservation effort. Aboard the DNRs Channel Cat research vessel, we learn about the sturgeon's ecological role, cultural significance, and the challenges the iconic fish facesfrom invasive species to habitat loss. The project supports sturgeon population recovery through egg collection, hatchery programs, and community events like Port Hurons Sturgeon Fest, organized by the Friends of the St. Clair River. Every year since its inception in 2012, Sturgeon Fest has released young sturgeon back into the wild, contributing to the unique species' resurgence in the Great Lakes region. This year, the Rivers are Life team helped tag two juvenile sturgeons, which made their debut in the popular festival's touch tank before release.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Noah Rucks heads to the rolling hills of Kentucky with hopes high and tags in his pocket. Chasing whitetails through both the early archery season and the later muzzleloader hunt, Noah experiences firsthand how unpredictable and humbling deer hunting can be.

programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Theres nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and thats exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. Its a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry wont be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and hes not very picky about the one that gets tied on. When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesnt matter because its all about the presentation, he says. When youre sitting on top of a wreck, break out the junk jigs they get bit just fine. And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, theres no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliarys new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed Andr 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real Andr announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: Salom (1953)
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friends marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: Three for the Show
programme.desc: Widowed by World War I, a Broadway star remarries her late husband's songwriting partner only to have the first one turn up very much alive.

programme.title: Convicted
programme.desc: During a barroom brawl, Joe Hufford (Glenn Ford) accidentally kills the son of a powerful, prominent man. The district attorney, George Knowland (Broderick Crawford), wins a manslaughter conviction, despite having doubts about the defendant's guilt. Joe is sent to prison, and George, who eventually becomes the warden there, hopes to get him released. But Joe gets so immersed in the culture and codes of the jailhouse that he finds it difficult to believe in his own innocence.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The New Daughters of Joshua Cabe

All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Cowboy

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle

programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons

programme.title: Renegades

Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: Santa Fe

programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.desc: The team investigates a police officer's murder; the team decides what is important to their futures.

programme.desc: Hodgins navigates life in a wheelchair; when a public defender is murdered, several of her previous clients had motives to kill her.

programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a men's rights organization founder who may have been the victim of domestic abuse; Brennan loses her temper during an interrogation; Angela and the team struggle with Hodgins' bitterness.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A suspect in the murder of a convicted felon who had been released to a halfway house has ties to Booth; Brennan testifies at an FBI hearing about her assault of an unarmed suspect from a previous case.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a private investigator found frozen after being dumped in the Potomac; Aubrey finds shocking information connected to his father's whereabouts.

programme.desc: The team investigates the death of an a cappella singer whose body was found in a lab rat; Hodgins applies for an experimental nerve regeneration study; Booth tries to plan a summer trip with Parker; a new intern joins the lab.

programme.desc: Toby and Michelle must recapture an escaped criminal mastermind before he can seek revenge.
